Dear Cody Akers:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/23/25, a youth was upset and put a chair against their chest
and ran into a brick wall. Staff intervened. The youth then started
to call people derogatory names and argued with staff. Staff were
unsuccessful in redirection. One staff member got into the youth's
face and used inappropriate language. Youth then threatened
suicide. The youth tried to block the staff from entering their room
and continued with attempting self-harm. The staff eventually
deescalated the situation.
Investigation Interviews:
On-call Therapist was interviewed via phone on March 25,
2025. On-call Therapist reported Youth A had been struggling with
his mental health the entire weekend and was on increased
checks due to behavioral concerns. She reported Staff 2 had
contacted her when there were concerns of Youth A struggling
with self-harm. On-call Therapist reported all cords and sharps
were removed from Youth A’s room for safety concerns. She
reported Staff 2 reported the concerns of Staff 1 yelling in Youth
A’s face.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
24, 2025. Youth A reported living at the facility since the beginning
of March 2025. He reported he has good days and bad days but
overall feels safe at the facility. Youth A reported staff make him
feel safe and are kind to him. He was asked about the incident
that occurred the day prior, and Youth A reported he does not
remember. When this consultant asked him about the incident of
trying to harm himself, Youth A reported that happens from time to
time but could not remember exactly what happened besides
being emotional. He reported when he gets into that state of mind,
he does not remember any details. This consultant asked Youth A
about his thoughts on Staff 1 and Staff 2, and he reported they are
good staff. He was asked to explain more about what a good staff
2

means, and Youth A reported it means that staff are not
emotionally, verbally, or physically abusive to him and keep him
safe. Youth A denied staff ever getting in his face, yelling at him,
or calling him names. He explained if he were to get in trouble at
the facility for not following rules, he would lose privileges such as
going on outings. Youth A reported he had no concerns about
staff or the facility to note.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on March 25, 2025. Staff 1
reported on March 23, 2025, he was working with Staff 2. He
reported on that day; Youth A was showing some elevated
behaviors. Staff 1 reported Youth A first started his day by trying
to take a plastic chair and run it into the side of the building. He
reported Youth A stated he did this so that he could get $5 from
Youth B as a bet he wouldn’t do it. Staff 1 reported after that
incident, Youth A sat in the milieu and began to call Youth C a
“bitch” and argue with her. He reported Youth C was supposedly
dating Youth A and had just broken up with him which made
Youth A upset. He reported during that time Youth D had asked
Staff 2 to get her shoes because she had recently hurt her leg.
Staff 1 reported Youth A then began to tell Youth D that she could
do that herself and started to call her names. At this point, Youth E
and Youth F started to antagonize Youth A to make him more
escalated and everyone in the milieu was yelling at one another.
Staff 1 reported he then stood up and yelled “Stop doing this shit
today.” He reported he knew that he should have not said this but
none of the youth could hear him when he was asking them to
calm down, so he just yelled. Staff 1 reported Youth A then got in
his face, yelled back at him and went to his bedroom. He reported
he was not yelling directly at Youth A and did not call him any
names. Staff 1 reported he yelled because he wanted them to
stop yelling. He stated he went to check in on Youth A and he
would not open his door. Staff 1 reported he sat outside of the
door near the staff office which allowed him to see into Youth A’s
room. He reported Staff 2 completed a room check and there were
concerns of Youth A trying to self-harm with a cord in his room.
Staff 1 reported he was able to verbally redirect Youth A to not
harm himself and had Youth A come talk with him in the staff
office to process what happened.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone March 25, 2025. Staff 2
reported on March 23, 2025, Youth A was having a rough day.
She reported she worked the first shift with Staff 1. Staff 2
reported she was helping Youth B get her hair done when Youth A
went outside. She reported she went outside with Youth B and
Youth A had put a chair against his chest and was running it into
3

the brick wall. Staff 2 reported she was able to redirect Youth A
back inside the house. When inside the house, Youth A began to
call Youth B and Youth C names such as “bitches.” Staff 2
reported when that was occurring, she had walked down to Youth
D’s room to help assist with getting her shoes. She reported when
she walked back to the milieu area, Staff 1 had gotten up from
where he was sitting and heard him say “I am tired of this shit.”
She reported Staff 1 was standing in front of Youth A when he
was yelling and was trying to get Youth A to stop yelling at the
other youth. During this time, Staff 2 reported she believed all the
youth were in the same area when Staff 1 was yelling and knows
for sure Youth B and Youth C were there. Staff 2 reported Youth A
took that very personally and he barricaded himself into his room.
She reported she was able to check on him in his room where
there were concerns noted of him trying to self-harm himself with
a cord. She reported that Staff 1 was able to verbally redirect
Youth A out of his room to come process with him. Staff 2
reported she called On-call Therapist about these concerns and
the behaviors Youth A was having. She reported staff are trained
to try to verbally de-escalate a situation and call for support when
needed. Staff 2 reported staff should never yell at youth like Staff
1 did that day.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth B reported she feels safe at the facility. She reported
she does not remember what happened on March 23, 2025.
Youth B reported Youth A is constantly having behavior issues
and has never seen staff respond to him inappropriately.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth C reported things are going well at the facility and
she feels safe with the staff. She reported on March 23, 2025, she
was triggered a bit when Youth A was yelling. She reported at one
point Staff 1 stood up and used his “dad” voice to calm everyone
down. When asked to explain more, Youth C reported Staff 1
yelled at everyone, “This not okay you cannot do this.” She
reported after Staff 1 yelled all the youth got quiet and everyone
listened. Youth C reported Staff 1 yelling did trigger her a bit about
her past when her parents would yell at her.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth D reported she feels safe at the facility. She reported
on March 23, 2025, she was trying to get ready to go to church
when Youth A continued to make negative comments at her and
flip her off. Youth D reported she told Youth A he needed to stop
and fix his behavior. She reported all the youth at the facility
4

started to get loud in the milieu area. Youth D reported at one
point Staff 1 yelled, “You need to knock this shit off.” She reported
Staff 1 did not make that statement directly at Youth A. Youth D
reported after Staff 1 yelled everyone became quiet and Youth A
ran to his room. She reported Staff 1 was calling for support when
things escalated. Youth D reported she felt like Staff 1 and Staff 2
handled the situation appropriately.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth E reported he had no concerns he wanted to talk
about. He reported when Youth A got upset on March 23, 2025,
Staff 1 and Staff 2 handled the situation appropriately and he had
no concerns.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth F reported he feels safe at the facility. He reported on
March 23, 2025, Youth A went into their room and tried to self-
harm himself. Youth F reported Staff 1 was able to get Youth A to
not harm himself and verbally process this situation. He reported
Youth A tried to harm himself after he was having behavioral
issues in the milieu area and Staff 1 yelled at Youth A. When
asked what Staff 1 said to Youth A, Youth F reported Staff 1 yelled
at Youth A to “calm down.” He reported after Staff 1 yelled,
everyone at the facility became quite because Staff 1 never yells
like that.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility incident report completed 03/28/2025 by Staff 2-
This incident report reviewed the incident on 3/23/2025.
Within this incident report Staff 2 reported Youth A was
behaviorally escalated and staff attempted to redirect Youth
A from yelling and swearing at his peers. Youth A ignored
the verbal redirects and Staff 2 interviewed by getting in
Youth A’s face and yelled, “I’m tired of this shit. You need
to stop.” This incident report is consistent with Staff 2’s
interview.
- Facility’s Resident Discipline Policy last revised
07/2024- Within this policy it notes the facility prohibits staff
to use verbal abuse included the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language, yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation towards a youth.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 was put on a
corrective action plan on 02/20/2015 due to Staff 1
speaking unprofessionally about a youth to the supervisor
5

and therapist. Staff 1 resigned from his position on
04/04/2025. Staff 1 is up to date on all required trainings
including de-escalation trainings on 03/21/2024 and
03/22/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews, Staff 1
did yell at Youth A and other youth at the facility when the milieu
was escalated.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
